testcase.name: TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook exists and is executable
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook produces valid JSON on Bash command
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook returns 'ask' for unknown commands
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook returns 'ask' for non-Bash tools
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook handles empty command gracefully
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook handles MCP tool requests
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook produces debug logs when PERMITTER_DEBUG=1
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook handles malformed JSON gracefully
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook can be disabled via environment variable
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook parses simple command
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook parses piped commands
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook parses chained commands
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook parses subshell commands
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook handles stdin EOF gracefully
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook handles missing tool_name field
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook handles missing tool_input field
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook output has correct hookEventName
TRD-TEST-099: permitter hook output behavior is valid enum
